title: Has Progress Stopped?

vestedInterestsSuppressingProgress.core Argument: Big interests now work AGAINST progress - exception is computing/IT
vestedInterestsSuppressingProgress.example: Best battery ever invented tomorrow? Oil industry + governments would say 'too much economic impact' and buy it out
vestedInterestsSuppressingProgress.hegemonicInterests: Overweight hegemonic interests in world economy suppressing massive disruptive progress
vestedInterestsSuppressingProgress.anticipatedPushback: 'You're a conspiracy theorist, Alex' - but thinks this is part of the cycle
vestedInterestsSuppressingProgress.jerryConfirmation: Vested interests kill golden goose progress
vestedInterestsSuppressingProgress.historicalExample: Great American Streetcar Conspiracy - GM, Firestone, Phillips66, Mack Truck bought light rail lines, turned down service, shut down lines, pulled up rails, burned cars → car culture not public transit

whatIsProgress.gilQuestion: Question behind the question: What IS progress?
gilExamples: Energy transition: renewable > coal globally now, striking price/performance progress over 20-30 years
Medical: wife 11 years in remission from disease that would've killed her in 2 years (cancer research progress)
Personal: induction range, rooftop solar, backup battery switching in microseconds - better experience, same electrons
whatIsProgress.gilChallenge: US lack of progress vs European cities shows progress may be highly localized, not about humanity overall
whatIsProgress.jerryFraming: Superficial: dramatic transformation of daily life (grandparents lived through electrification, hygiene revolution)
whatIsProgress.whereIsMyFlyingCar: Expected hexacopter Uber by now - but maybe that's not real progress
whatIsProgress.progressMightBeRelentment: Maybe real progress is NOT pushing addictive technology on us - progress might be entirely different

mikeNarrowingQuestion.mikeProposal: 'Provocative and obnoxious': rewrite the question - we've been diverted 10 minutes defining progress, not useful, all have different definitions (Mike has 5+)
mikeNarrowingQuestion.narrowedQuestion: Are there more barriers to technological development than in the past?
mikesProgressDimensions: Applying discoveries in cool new technologies
Economic barriers preventing use (super battery example)
Building societies in better ways (societal progress, governance evolution)
mikeNarrowingQuestion.mikeWarning: Question so broad we'll all talk past each other - each person different place of what progress is most important
mikeNarrowingQuestion.alternateFraming: Quality of daily life improvement over 200 years plateauing or ceasing?
mikeNarrowingQuestion.mikeView: Would argue against globally, but US quality of life not doing well - 'amusing ourselves to death', conflicting demands, Confusopoly (Dilbert term)
mikeNarrowingQuestion.confusopoly: Companies throwing so many options, constantly confusing what product is and how much we pay - no time to sort through crap

customerServiceEnshittification.observation: Companies won't answer phone when you call them
customerServiceEnshittification.aiImpact: Despite new AI tools, call centers doing BETTER job of diverting away from end goal than getting there
bookRecommendations: 'Enshittification' by Cory Doctorow - why can't we have good things? Why aren't tech breakthroughs leading to customer service + quality of life improvements?
'Breakneck' - subtitle says it all (Mike didn't finish describing)

progressAsTransformationOfDailyLife.description: Jerry and Gil's surface-level progress metric
jerryExamples: Hygiene revolution (great-grandparents) - outhouse → running clean water
Supersonic travel would be perceived (vs renewable energy behind curtain)
AI might be next large transformation happening right now
progressAsTransformationOfDailyLife.gilCounter: Behind curtain matters too - rooftop solar, induction range, backup battery = better experience even if 'same electrons'
progressAsTransformationOfDailyLife.jerrySkepticism: Don't particularly want urban airscapes littered with drones/air taxis - fender bender ignorable, quadcopter crash not

questionsRaised: Are there more barriers to technological development than in the past?
Why do vested interests suppress disruptive progress?
Is progress transformation of daily life, or deeper systemic change?
Why aren't technological breakthroughs leading to quality of life improvements?
Is progress localized (Europe vs US) rather than global?
Is AI the next large transformation we're living through?

booksAndResources.title: Enshittification
booksAndResources.author: Cory Doctorow
booksAndResources.about: Why can't we have good things? Why tech breakthroughs don't lead to quality improvements

booksAndResources.title: Breakneck
booksAndResources.about: Deeper and more important book (subtitle not fully described in excerpt)

booksAndResources.outcome: Killed public transit to sell buses, found for antitrust but too late

booksAndResources.description: Companies confuse what product is and pricing to prevent comparison

specialNotes: Call explicitly about meta-question: has progress stopped?
Group immediately fragments on definition of progress (Mike: we'll talk past each other)
Alex brings vested interests framework from start
Gil brings personal (wife's cancer), local (rooftop solar), global (renewable energy) examples
Mike tries to narrow to something specific (technological barriers)
Jerry open to 'progress might be relentment on addictive tech' - skeptical of tech progress
Enshittification theme continues from Call 10 (Gil's question about monetization)
Customer service degradation despite AI - ironic
Europe vs US progress localization - challenges universal narrative
emotionalTone: Provoc ative (Mike self-describes), definitional wrestling, skepticism about mainstream progress narrative

participationNotes.Jerry Michalski: Facilitator, raised topic, open to multiple definitions, skeptical of flying cars
participationNotes.Alex Kladitis: Led with vested interests suppression, hegemonic interests, anticipated conspiracy theory pushback
participationNotes.Gil Friend: Challenged definition, brought renewable energy data, personal medical example, rooftop solar
participationNotes.Mike Nelson: Provocative reframing, narrowing to technological barriers, Enshittification book rec, Confusopoly concept

crossCallThemes: Enshittification (Call 10 Gil's question, Call 12 Mike's focus)
Definition debates (Calls 05, 07, 08, 09, now 12 - what is progress?)
Vested interests (Call 13 Crony Capitalism will develop this further)
Systemic change vs surface metrics (ongoing pattern)
